job_title: Registered Nurse, MSN in Killeen, TX
pros: AHCT is a wonderful employer. As the wife of a career soldier, I had the opportunity to work at multiple hospitals in varying cities and states. AHCT has been the best, by far. People genuinely care about one another here. The organization is full of people who are focused on providing high quality, safe and optimal care. There is always a focus on providing not only great care but also a great experience to the patients who trust us to care for them. Additionally, AH seeks to ensure their employees feel loved. During COVID when hospitals were laying people off, AH ensured all of their employees remained employed and financially whole. Diversity is celebrated here! That's huge for me. There has been lots of opportunity for growth and career advancement in my nearly 10 years of employment here.
cons: No place is perfect and AHCT is not an exception. However, there is continuous effort to reflect and evaluate for opportunities to improve. Patient Experience and patient feedback is taken very seriously. Employee feedback is sought out via multiple platforms, giving everyone the opportunity to have a voice. This allows any "cons" to be out in the open and demands attention.

pros: Location close to where I live.
cons: Old nurse bully new nurses, horrible CNA. Bad management.

pros: Some great people who want to excel in a company with wasted potential.
cons: Senior leadership has all but disappeared.  Mid-level management uses favoritism, chastisement and the like to 'control' their areas without restraint.  Staff employees are held to standards by managers who routinely break them. Hypocrisy and turnover rate are high.  Innovators are discouraged and/or chased away.  Automation of processes and departments is clunky and not user friendly.  There is a lot of promotion about perks and rewards for staff but little is done to ensure that they actually get to take advantage of them, which is essentially just dangling a carrot that never gets eaten.  It feels like this place is in a death spiral.

review_title: So much potential headed in the wrong direction
pros: Close to home.  Has an abundance of staff who are trying to do the right thing, struggling to make a difference & eager to support the mission of "Extending the Healing ministry of Christ"; has a lot of untapped potential working for them.
cons: Administration consistently makes poor decisions. Despite their mission, they fail to extend the same care, compassion & "healing ministry" to their own employees. The 'Good old Boy' network in a growing but still small town continues to allow bad behavior, particularly the misuse of resources and abuse of employees by certain physicians. Instead of correcting the bad behaviors and business practices of a handful of physicians, managers & directors, Administration chooses to put the onus on the backs of their nursing staff, techs and aides. There is a complete lack of communication from the top down. There is almost no attempt to educate and elevate staff. If you enjoy being micromanaged,this place excels in this management style. Instead of inspiring staff to do their best, they keep cutting benefits, hours, pay and now even the safety of staff & patients; while visibly putting resources into furniture, "huddle" boards, and catered meetings for upper management/physicians. Pharmacy has been allowed to become the final arbiter of what meds can be administered to patients without speaking to the ordering physician(s) - one of the craziest practices we have ever seen. Hospital-wide morale is at an all-time low. A lot of lip service is given to improving practices, following standards of care, appreciation of coworkers, etc. but the reality is that the staff do not feel appreciated, heard, or valued. In fact, it is safe to say that over the past six-months or so, staff look scared, troubled, unhappy and expressly feel dehumanized.

job_title: RN, Case Manager in Killeen, TX
pros: Faith based Acute Care Hospital which values and encourages its employees, attentive engaged CEO/ Admin who listen and act on the needs of both staff and patients, consistent encouragement of process improvement throughout the facility, community centered organization with multiple programs dedicated to support the health & well being of residents.
cons: Utilizes a remote HR system in a different city which can make the hiring process less efficient and personal, and the tasks required pre/ post employment take longer. Orientation for each department could be more structured and utilized evidence based education materials (ie, ENA, ACM, AORN, CCRN manuals.)

review_title: Former Employer, but will never be a patient...(LDR/Postpartum)
pros:
RNs don't eat there young
Many seasoned nurses--they will take the time to help you
cons:
Lack of professionalism between departments (Nursery, LDR, Postpartum)
Expected responsibilities  change weekly (without training)
Management is not supportive (except towards favorites)
LD doesn't do recovery
The way the units run is antiquated 
Supplies are not always available to do job (sometimes you have to call other floors for supplies)
I WOULD NEVER HAVE A BABY OR ANY PROCEDURES DONE AT THIS HOSPITAL

pros: I’ve been working here for almost a decade and the pay has gotten much better as they’ve adjusted the market. They offer two health insurance packages, and if you pick the “more expensive” option, the coverage is amazing. Everyone is super friendly and it’s a very personable workplace. Through COVID, the hospital guaranteed everyone’s hours while other hospitals were rapidly laying off employees. This by itself shows how much they truly care for their employees.
cons: Can’t really think of any cons, and I have no intention of leaving.

pros: The doctors I worked with were great.
cons: Pay was lower than what was considered normal. Management was fear-based leadership. I was yelled at by my boss on numerous occasions. They expected me to do two different jobs disguised as one job. I was told at my interview that I would receive 4-6 weeks of training to be successful and I received less than a week.

review_title: Look at all your options first
pros: Clean, well maintained facility. Growing service lines. Decent pay in low socioeconomic area. Ok improved rep in the community and marketing is strong. People are friendly.
cons: Massive turnover. Numerous directors and managers gone in the last year. Poor staff retention and no effort to create retention plan. Leadership expectations are 7 days a week so don't expect any family time. Not enough staff to meet demands.

job_title: Licensed Clinical Social Worker in Killeen, TX
pros: Worked in the outpatient behavioral health clinic facilitating assessments of first-time patients scheduled to see prescriber.  Great group of people; very fast-paced clinic.  Management very supportive of their employees.
cons: Job was scheduled to go full-time; process was very slow; however, when this job is advertised, it will be a full-time position.  The only reason I resigned was that I received a full-time job offer in another city.

review_title: Constantly trying to convince the employees that it was a good place to work
pros: Initially there were regularly scheduled performance evaluations and commesurate salary increases. More and more employees even in light of layoffs within the organization and in the local area.
cons: Employees are expected to work whenever scheduled and regularly not relieved on time then threatened if you go into overtime. Terminations happened regularly if you get on someone's "bad side" you were on the short list out the door. Rampant HAE(hospital acquired infections) and inadequate precautions taken to protect employees

pros: Friendly and courteous  always educating and give opportunities for advancement and cross training for different departments. Helps that they have a lot of sister hospital all over
